amendment.description: Amendment authorizes funding for the National Institutes of Health to conduct research directed toward computational techniques and software tools in support of biomedical and behavioral research.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 14 printed in the Congressional Record to authorize $233 million for FY 2001, $242 million for FY 2002, and $250 million for FYs 2003-2004 for NIH. The amendment requires NIH to use the funding for biomedical and behavioral research.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Morella amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.
